definition: to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: Once he got rich,he flung aside his old freinds.
sentences.chinese: 他有錢後就立即拋棄了舊友。

sentences.english: That he's not going to suddenly be left adrift.
sentences.chinese: 他不會突然一下子被拋棄。

sentences.english: Keep in mind that is bad is not abandoned.
sentences.chinese: 要記住，被拋棄的並不一定就是不好的。

sentences.english: In the process of translation, we have left behind some of the original data .
sentences.chinese: 在移譯的過程中，我們拋棄了某些原有的論據。

sentences.english: Eg: A true friend never abandons you in times of need.
sentences.chinese: 一個真正的朋友永遠不會在你需要的時候拋棄你。

sentences.english: He doffed his stupid ideas and joined our side.
sentences.chinese: 他拋棄了他的愚蠢觀念並參加到我們方面來。

sentences.english: You will also face heartbreak and abandonment by those you love.
sentences.chinese: 你同樣吸菸削尖削尖時刻以及你深愛的人的拋棄。

sentences.english: I shook off the discipline of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我拋棄了城裏的那些清規戒律。

sentences.english: As soon as she became rich she cast all her old friends aside.
sentences.chinese: 她一有了錢便馬上拋棄了所有的朋友。

sentences.english: We should abandon all outmoded conventions and customs to keep pace with new era.
sentences.chinese: 我們要拋棄陳規陋習以跟上新時代的步伐。

sentences.english: He told her that Windu was responsible for the abandonment of her former Jedi mentor.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴文崔斯溫都就是該對拋棄她從前導師負責的人。

sentences.english: Companies need to learn how to unlearn , to slough off yesterdays wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 公司要學會怎樣放棄，要勇於拋棄昨日的成就。

sentences.english: Such die-hards will be discard by history.
sentences.chinese: 這種頑固分子會被歷史所拋棄。

sentences.english: Can you jettison cargo aft to refloat?
sentences.chinese: 你船能拋棄後面的貨物使船浮起嗎？

sentences.english: Forsaking all I've fallen for, I rise to meet the end.
sentences.chinese: 拋棄那些我曾依戀的一切，我往上迎向我的盡頭。

sentences.english: She ditched her boyfriend for the rock star.
sentences.chinese: 她拋棄了她的男朋友而愛上了這個搖滾舞星。

definition: to offer for sale/to sell/to sell out or betray
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away
